H0.text: Pituitary is the gland that secretes growth hormones.

H1.text: The pineal gland secretes growth hormones.

H3.text: The thyroid gland is the gland that secretes growth hormones.

A4.text: The anterior pituitary synthesizes and secretes hormones. All releasing hormones (-RH) referred to can also be referred to as releasing factors (-RF). Somatotropes: Growth hormone (GH), also known as somatotropin, is released under the influence of hypothalamic growth hormone-releasing hormone (GHRH), and is inhibited by hypothalamic somatostatin.
